Interface CommonSteps.ConvertToStep<F>

public static interface CommonSteps.ConvertToStep<F> extends Step
Step for converting between from- and to-types.

  • Method Details

    • convertTo

      <T> Step convertTo(IConverter<? super F,? extends T> converter)
      Sets the from-to direction converter on the resulting binding. The defines the type of the to-end observable.
      Type Parameters:
      T - type of the to-end observable
      Parameters:
      converter - the converter to set
      Returns:
      next step
      See Also:
      • UpdateValueStrategy.setConverter(org.eclipse.core.databinding.conversion.IConverter<? super S, ? extends D>)

    • defaultConvert

      Step defaultConvert()
      Makes the resulting binding use default converters between the two observables. Because of this an observable of any type may be used.

      For example, converters to and from strings and numeric types are available.

      However, the IObservableValue.getValueType() or IObservableCollection.getElementType() of both the observables must be non-null.

      See DataBindingContext for information about types that have default converters and how they work.

      Returns:
      next step
      See Also:
      • UpdateValueStrategy(boolean, int)
